content: tortellini the tortoise - african flower tortoise you will need roughly 25-30g of yarn in at least two colours plus a small amount of red yarn safety eyes recommended 7mm 2 5mm hook you can use any hook size that works with your chosen yarn but this will impact the size of the project i used 2 5mm with dk yarn polyfill / stuffing a needle and thread/ fabric glue optional legs make 4 round 1 8sc in the magic_ring round 2-13 8sc around to create tubes slip_stitch to finish and cast off leave a long tail for sewing on later stuff the legs firmly before attaching african flower shell make 6 round 1 in colour 1 create a magic_ring/ring chain 3 this counts as you first double_crochet double_crochet chain 1 2dc chain 1 x4 slip_stitch to the top of your beginning chain 3 change to colour 2 round 2 chain 3 double_crochet chain 1 2dc in the same space then 2dc chain 1 2dc in each chain 1 space from the previous round slip_stitch to the top of your beginning chain 3 round 3 chain 3 6d in same space 7dc in each chain 1 space around note there should be groups of 4 double_crochet between each 7dc slip_stitch to the top of your beginning chain 3 change back to colour 1 round 4 chain 1 single_crochet in each double_crochet of the 7dc groups i e 6sc then 7 single_crochet spiked double_crochet* in the space between the 4dc groups from round 2 repeat around slip_stitch to cast off *spiked double_crochet instead of working your double_crochet into the normal v working the double_crochet in the base of the stitch below/named in the pattern to create the shell sew or slip single_crochet the 6 flowers together with one at the centre and the others around it it may be easier to block the shapes for more defined edges first but this isn t necessary underside of the shell circle round 1 6sc in the magic_ring round 2 increase each stitch around 12sc round 3 1sc 1 increase x6 18sc round 4 1sc increase 1sc x6 24sc round 5 3sc increase x6 30sc round 6 2sc increase 2sc x6 36sc round 7 5sc increase x6 42sc round 8 3sc increase 3sc x6 48sc round 9 7sc increase x6 54sc round 10 4sc increase 4sc x6 60sc round 11 9sc increase x6 66sc round 12 5sc increase 5sc x6 72sc round 13 11sc increase x6 78sc round 14 6sc increase 6sc x6 84sc round 15 13sc increase x6 90sc your circle will need to fit snuggly in the underside of your shell so you may need to adjust the amount of rounds depending on how tight your stitches are if you need to create more rounds follow the pattern of single_crochet and increase adding one to the number of scs each time even rounds are split in two with the increase in the middle to spread increases out and ensure the circle remains
